title: `__non_webpack_require__` regression since version 4.22.0
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

The problem is that Webpack, starting from version `4.22.0`, is now _parsing_ the entire

```js
typeof __non_webpack_require__ !== 'undefined'
```

expression during the build process, causing the above line to be reduced to `true`.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

This bug originates from Mozilla's PDF.js repository. In https://github.com/mozilla/pdf.js/pull/10170#issuecomment-431697032 we made a build of the viewer with a Webpack version higher than 4.21.0, the last working version. Since 4.22.0 this is broken. In https://github.com/mozilla/pdf.js/pull/10170#issuecomment-431697032 the difference between the output of version 4.21.0 and 4.22.0 is highlighted. The original source code line is here: https://github.com/mozilla/pdf.js/blob/81f5835cd7024827e0671ccd66525df98fb15703/src/display/api.js#L56

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

The expected, and previous output, is that `__non_webpack_require__` is replaced with `require` as

```js
typeof require !== 'undefined'
```

According to the documentation, this _should_ still work; see https://webpack.js.org/api/module-variables/#__non_webpack_require__-webpack-specific

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  4.21.0 (last working version), 4.22.0 (first broken version), latest (still broken)
Node.js version: latest
Operating System: Linux/Windows
Additional tools:
